description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的机关报，与新华社及中央广播电视总台并称“三大央媒”，为中华人民共和国第一大报。1992年被联合国评为“世界十大报纸”之一。
description.en: The official newspaper of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. Along with Xinhua News Agency and China Media Group, it is known as one of the 'three major central media outlets' and is the largest newspaper in the People's Republic of China. It was named one of the 'Top Ten Newspapers in the World' by the United Nations in 1992.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会
en: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的中央领导机构。
description.en: The central leading body of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会主席，建议将报纸命名为《人民日报》并为其题写报名。在文化大革命等时期对该报有决定性影响。
description.en: Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, who suggested the newspaper's name 'People's Daily' and inscribed its masthead. He had a decisive influence on the paper during periods such as the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 《人民日报》第一任社长。
description.en: The first President of the People's Daily.

description.zh-cn: 1949年8月1日起担任《人民日报》社长。
description.en: Served as the President of the People's Daily starting from August 1, 1949.

description.zh-cn: 1949年8月1日起担任《人民日报》总编辑，后在文革初期被吴冷西接替。
description.en: Served as the Editor-in-Chief of the People's Daily starting from August 1, 1949, and was later replaced by Wu Lengxi at the beginning of the Cultural Revolution.

en: North China Bureau of the CPC Central Committee

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在华北地区的派出机构。《人民日报》在1948年至1949年间曾是其机关报。
description.en: The dispatched agency of the Communist Party of China in the North China region. The People's Daily served as its official newspaper between 1948 and 1949.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国于1958年至1961年间在全国范围内开展的试图利用各地劳动力和群众热情，在工业和农业上“跃进”的社会主义建设运动。
description.en: A socialist construction movement in the People's Republic of China from 1958 to 1961, which aimed to utilize local labor and mass enthusiasm to achieve a 'leap forward' in industry and agriculture.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动，对中国社会造成了深远影响。《人民日报》在此期间是重要的宣传工具。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong, which had a profound impact on Chinese society. The People's Daily was a key propaganda tool during this period.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命开始时接替邓拓任《人民日报》总编辑，后被陈伯达夺权。
description.en: Succeeded Deng Tuo as Editor-in-Chief of the People's Daily at the beginning of the Cultural Revolution, but his authority was later seized by Chen Boda.

description.zh-cn: 中央文革小组组长，在1966年5月带领工作组夺取了《人民日报》的领导权。
description.en: Leader of the Cultural Revolution Group, who led a work team to seize control of the People's Daily in May 1966.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间的实际最高权力机构之一，曾直接领导《人民日报》。
description.en: One of the de facto highest authorities during the Cultural Revolution, which directly led the People's Daily.

nodes.id: 第一张马列主义大字报

zh-cn: 第一张马列主义大字报

description.zh-cn: 由北京大学聂元梓等人撰写的大字报，其在《人民日报》的发表是文化大革命全面展开的重要标志之一。
description.en: A big-character poster written by Nie Yuanzi and others from Peking University. Its publication in the People's Daily was one of the key signals for the full-scale launch of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 北京大学哲学系教师，《第一张马列主义大字报》的主要作者。
description.en: A teacher in the Philosophy Department of Peking University and the main author of 'The First Marxist-Leninist Big-Character Poster'.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第二代主要领导人。文革后期《人民日报》曾发起“批邓”运动，改革开放后该报又刊登其关于和平统一的设想。
description.en: The paramount leader of the second generation of the People's Republic of China. In the later stages of the Cultural Revolution, the People's Daily launched a campaign to criticize him. After the Reform and Opening-up, the paper published his ideas on peaceful unification.

description.zh-cn: 1976年4月5日在天安门广场发生的以悼念周恩来为主题的群众抗议活动，后被《人民日报》社论定性为“反革命事件”。
description.en: A mass protest held at Tiananmen Square on April 5, 1976, centered on mourning Zhou Enlai, which was later branded as a 'counter-revolutionary incident' by a People's Daily editorial.

nodes.id: 必须旗帜鲜明地反对动乱

zh-cn: 必须旗帜鲜明地反对动乱
en: It is Necessary to Take a Clear-cut Stand Against Disturbances

description.zh-cn: 1989年4月26日《人民日报》发表的社论，将当时的学生运动定性为“动乱”，激化了矛盾。
description.en: An editorial published by the People's Daily on April 26, 1989, which labeled the student movement of the time as 'turmoil,' thereby intensifying the conflict.

description.zh-cn: 1989年发生在中国北京的由学生发起的抗议示威活动。事件后，《人民日报》多名领导和编辑被撤职或判刑。
description.en: Student-led protests that took place in Beijing, China in 1989. After the incident, several leaders and editors of the People's Daily were dismissed or imprisoned.

description.zh-cn: 时任《人民日报》总社长，在六四天安门事件后被撤职。
description.en: Then-President of the People's Daily, who was dismissed after the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 时任《人民日报》总编辑，在六四天安门事件后被撤职。
description.en: Then-Editor-in-Chief of the People's Daily, who was dismissed after the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 《人民日报》编辑，在六四天安门事件期间因私印号外被判入狱四年。
description.en: An editor at the People's Daily who was sentenced to four years in prison for unofficially printing an extra edition during the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会总书记。2016年对党媒提出48字指导纲领，对《人民日报》等媒体的工作方针产生影响。
description.en: General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. In 2016, he proposed a 48-character guiding principle for party media, influencing the operational policies of outlets like the People's Daily.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国前第一夫人，曾承认《人民日报》海外版的排版优于台湾的《中央日报》。
description.en: Former First Lady of the Republic of China, who once acknowledged that the layout of the People's Daily Overseas Edition was superior to that of Taiwan's Central Daily News.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党在台湾的主要机关报，曾是《人民日报》海外版的主要竞争对手。
description.en: The main official newspaper of the Kuomintang in Taiwan, which was a major competitor to the People's Daily Overseas Edition.

description.zh-cn: 曾任《人民日报》总编辑及社长。
description.en: Former Editor-in-Chief and President of the People's Daily.

description.zh-cn: 曾任《人民日报》总编辑及社长。
description.en: Former Editor-in-Chief and President of the People's Daily.

description.zh-cn: 曾任《人民日报》总编辑，现任社长。
description.en: Former Editor-in-Chief and current President of the People's Daily.

description.zh-cn: 现任《人民日报》总编辑。
description.en: Current Editor-in-Chief of the People's Daily.

relationships.target: 中国共产党中央委员会

description.zh-cn: 《人民日报》是中国共产党中央委员会的机关报。
description.en: The People's Daily is the official newspaper of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 建议将中共晋冀鲁豫中央局机关报命名为《人民日报》，并于1946年和1948年两次为该报题写报名。
description.en: Suggested naming the official newspaper of the CPC Jin-Ji-Lu-Yu Central Bureau 'People's Daily' and inscribed the masthead for the paper twice, in 1946 and 1948.

description.zh-cn: 在其《关于〈人民日报〉等报纸的理论水平的批语》中批评人民日报社论不涉及理论，只能算是第二流报纸。
description.en: In his 'Comments on the Theoretical Level of Newspapers such as the People's Daily,' he criticized the paper for its editorials lacking theory, calling it a second-rate newspaper.

description.zh-cn: 在1948年6月15日至1949年7月31日期间，《人民日报》是中共中央华北局的机关报。
description.en: From June 15, 1948, to July 31, 1949, the People's Daily was the official newspaper of the North China Bureau of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 发表多篇社论，提出“全国大跃进”和“人有多大的胆，地有多大的产”等口号，并报道“放卫星”等虚假高产新闻，为大跃进运动推波助澜。
description.en: Published multiple editorials promoting slogans like 'Nationwide Great Leap Forward' and 'The land's output is as great as people's courage,' and reported false news of high yields ('launching satellites'), thus fueling the Great Leap Forward movement.

description.zh-cn: 发表《横扫一切牛鬼蛇神》等多篇社论，并刊登《第一张马列主义大字报》，为文化大革命的全面发动进行舆论宣传。
description.en: Published editorials such as 'Sweep Away All Monsters and Demons' and 'The First Marxist-Leninist Big-Character Poster,' conducting propaganda for the full-scale launch of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 陈伯达带领工作组在《人民日报》夺取了总编辑吴冷西和编委会的权力。
description.en: Chen Boda led a work team to seize power from Editor-in-Chief Wu Lengxi and the editorial board at the People's Daily.

description.zh-cn: 陈伯达夺权后，《人民日报》改由中央文革小组领导。
description.en: After Chen Boda seized power, the People's Daily came under the leadership of the Cultural Revolution Group.

relationships.target: 第一张马列主义大字报

description.zh-cn: 与另外六位教师共同撰写了《第一张马列主义大字报》。
description.en: Co-authored 'The First Marxist-Leninist Big-Character Poster' with six other teachers.

description.zh-cn: 发表《牢牢掌握斗争大方向》、《天安门广场事件说明了什么?》等社论，坚持“批邓”运动，并称邓小平是天安门广场反革命事件的“总后台”。
description.en: Published editorials such as 'Firmly Grasp the Main Orientation of the Struggle' and 'What Does the Tiananmen Square Incident Explain?', insisting on the 'Criticize Deng' campaign and labeling Deng Xiaoping as the 'backstage boss' of the counter-revolutionary incident at Tiananmen Square.

description.zh-cn: 发表社论《天安门广场事件说明了什么?》，将参加四五运动的群众定义为“反革命分子”。
description.en: Published the editorial 'What Does the Tiananmen Square Incident Explain?', which defined the participants of the April Fifth Movement as 'counter-revolutionaries'.

relationships.target: 必须旗帜鲜明地反对动乱

description.zh-cn: 在头版头条刊发了社论《必须旗帜鲜明地反对动乱》。
description.en: Published the editorial 'It is Necessary to Take a Clear-cut Stand Against Disturbances' as the front-page headline.

relationships.source: 必须旗帜鲜明地反对动乱

description.zh-cn: 该社论将学生活动定性为动乱，激化了学生与政府的矛盾，刺激了事态的升级。
description.en: The editorial labeled the student activities as turmoil, which intensified the conflict between the students and the government, escalating the situation.

description.zh-cn: 六四天安门事件后，《人民日报》总社长钱李仁被撤职。
description.en: After the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests, Qian Liren, the President of the People's Daily, was dismissed.

description.zh-cn: 六四天安门事件后，《人民日报》总编辑谭文瑞被撤职。
description.en: After the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests, Tan Wenrui, the Editor-in-Chief of the People's Daily, was dismissed.

description.zh-cn: 六四天安门事件后，编辑吴学灿因私印人民日报号外被判入狱四年。
description.en: After the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests, editor Wu Xuecan was sentenced to four years in prison for unofficially printing an extra edition of the People's Daily.

description.zh-cn: 在党媒调研时，以48字方针为《人民日报》等中国媒体定义了新时代的价值观和指导纲领。
description.en: During his research tour of party media, he defined the values and guiding principles for the new era for Chinese media, including the People's Daily, with a 48-character directive.

description.zh-cn: 作为中国共产党和中国国民党的机关报，两者是意识形态和新闻领域的竞争对手。1985年，宋美龄曾承认《人民日报》海外版的排版优于《中央日报》航空版。
description.en: As the official newspapers of the Communist Party of China and the Kuomintang, respectively, they were competitors in ideology and news. In 1985, Soong Mei-ling acknowledged that the layout of the People's Daily Overseas Edition was superior to that of the Central Daily News's airmail edition.
